title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: CV
text:
Publications


[1] J. Aalbers et al., Cosmogenic Production of ${̂37}$Ar in the Context of the LUX-ZEPLIN Experiment, Physical Review D 105, 082004 (2022).


[2] T. Pershing et al., Performance of Hamamatsu VUV4 SiPMs for Detecting Liquid Argon Scintillation, Journal of Instrumentation 17, P04017 (2022).


[3] J. Aalbers et al., A Next-Generation Liquid Xenon Observatory for Dark Matter and Neutrino Physics, arXiv:2203.02309 (2022).


[4] J. Aalbers et al., Background Determination for the LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Dark Matter Experiment, arXiv:2211.17120 (2022).


[5] J. Aalbers et al., First Dark Matter Search Results from the LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Experiment, arXiv:2207.03764 (2022).


[6] E. P. Bernard et al., Thermodynamic Stability of Xenon-Doped Liquid Argon Detectors, arXiv:2209.05435 (2022).


[7] T. Pershing et al., Calibrating the Scintillation and Ionization Responses of Xenon Recoils for High-Energy Dark Matter Searches, Physical Review D 106, 052013 (2022).


[8] E. Mizrachi, N. Bowden, I. Jovanovic, E. Bernard, and S. Pereverzev, Development of a Xenon-Doped Dual-Phase Argon Time Projection Chamber, in Bulletin of the American Physical Society, Vols. Volume 66, Number 5 (American Physical Society, 2021).


[9] T. LUX-ZEPLIN et al., Projected Sensitivity of the LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Experiment to the Two-Neutrino and Neutrinoless Double Beta Decays of ${̂134}$Xe, Physical Review C 104, 065501 (2021).


[10] T. L.-Z. Collaboration et al., Simulations of Events for the LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Dark Matter Experiment, Astroparticle Physics 125, 102480 (2021).


[11] D. S. Akerib et al., Enhancing the Sensitivity of the LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Dark Matter Experiment to Low Energy Signals, arXiv:2101.08753 (2021).


[12] T. L. Collaboration et al., Projected Sensitivities of the LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Experiment to New Physics via Low-Energy Electron Recoils, Physical Review D 104, 092009 (2021).


[13] T. L. Collaboration et al., The LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Experiment, Nuclear Instruments and Methods in Physics Research Section A: Accelerators, Spectrometers, Detectors and Associated Equipment 953, 163047 (2020).


[14] D. S. Akerib et al., Projected Sensitivity of the LUX-ZEPLIN Experiment to the $0\nu\beta\beta$ Decay of ${̂136}$Xe, Physical Review C 102, 014602 (2020).


[15] D. S. Akerib et al., The LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Radioactivity and Cleanliness Control Programs, The European Physical Journal C 80, 1044 (2020).


[16] B. J. Mount et al., LUX-ZEPLIN (LZ) Technical Design Report, arXiv:1703.09144 (2017).


[17] D. S. Akerib et al., Identification of Radiopure Titanium for the LZ Dark Matter Experiment and Future Rare Event Searches, Astroparticle Physics 96, 1 (2017).


[18] K. Kamdin, E. Mizrachi, J. A. Morad, and P. Sorensen, Absolute Electron Extraction Efficiency of Liquid Xenon, in Bulletin of the American Physical Society, Vols. Volume 61, Number 6 (American Physical Society, Salt Lake City, Utah, 2016).


[19] M. Goryachev, A. Lo, P. Haslinger, E. Mizrachi, L. Anderegg, H. Müller, M. Hohensee, and M. E. Tobar, Acoustic Tests of Lorentz Symmetry Using Bulk Acoustic Wave Quartz Oscillators, arXiv:1607.07179 (2016).


[20] A. Lo, P. Haslinger, E. Mizrachi, L. Anderegg, H. Müller, M. Hohensee, M. Goryachev, and M. E. Tobar, Acoustic Tests of Lorentz Symmetry Using Quartz Oscillators, Physical Review X 6, 011018 (2016).
